This game is amazing, definetly worth the investment.

The Campaign mode is long and has a good story, but is a lot less lonely and empty than Portal 1.

The Co-Op mode is pretty fun locally, but I do not recommend playing with a random citizen. They tend to be trolls, squeakers, or people who never bothered to play the main campaign first, let alone beat it.

I have completed the main story well over 10 times, and I would recommend this game. If you like the desolate, lonely nature of the first, this game may not be as well recieved, as it has a lot of voice acting from many characters, and it doesn't feel quite as desolate until later in the game. I would recommend having at least 1 cooperative friend to play with if you want to do the Co-Op mode, but other than that this game is nearly perfect.

Rated 8.75/10

Same basic premise with new mechanics added on top for challenging puzzles. Solid story with great voice acting. Awesome ending that'll make you giddy. I don't know why I waited so long to pick this up. Altogether a much more polished experience than the original which was fantastic in itself. If you play games on PC this is a must-play.

OK! Just completed the game. Game-play time for me took about 10-12 hours (currently my play time is 14 hours, but i spent about 2 making a Testing Chamber) If you play this game consistently enough, you can beat its story mode in about 2-4 days. Portal 2 is aboslutly AMAZING! It's a must have for those who LOVE challenging puzzles, creativity, and sarcastic humor! Though I haven't played Portal 1 yet, this game makes me want it more just to see what the original was like! I hope this review inspires you to buy Portal 2. If so, then get to testing, you crazy Test Subjects!
Great game, in many ways better than the first.
best game ever
Sin palabras. Simplemente épico.

i decided to revisit this game after so many years and boy am i glad i did. Not only does this engine still look great and run buttery smooth but it also still stands up well exhibiting some truely brilliant physics. 
Scripting and voice acting in the game are just about as good as it gets with excellent work from it's humorous three main charaters. If you take your time to explore the finer detail it just gets funnier, especially as you learn the true background of Apature CEO Cave Johnson; who has some of the best laugh-out-loud lines in the game.
The puzzles are excellent and well paced. After such a long time since i first played it, i fully enjoyed relearning them over.
Replaying this masterpiece has only confirmed just how much modern titles have to live up to. If anything it just leaves me wishing for valve to release something new, they sure do take their time, but for results like these it could not be more worth the wait!
10/10

"Portal 2" is an excellent follow-up to the original "Portal."  Everything that was great in the original is still here, plus they've actually improved it:  graphics, voice acting, humor, design.  All excellent.  And the story is tremendous.  Not only does it have a story of its own, but it's gone back and fleshed out the historical story leading up to "Portal."  Definitely a buy.

This game was advertised as being cross platform.... well it's not. I have spent hours, reading forums, watching youtube fixes and messing with it and have not been able to run multiplayer pc and ps3. I learned that I am not the only one with this issue. The game itself is great, countless hours of single player fun. But I hate false advertisements, so thumbs down.

More Portal Please! One of the greatest games ever made. Smart, funny, and just plain fun. You don't need to play the original to enjoy this great game but I insist you do just to invest a little more in the lore. It is all about the puzzles and gameplay but there is a subtle backstory that many will fall in love with. Amazing how much feeling you can feel in a game about a mute girl/lab and a robot that is obsessed with test. A nice change of pace if you are a fan of the Half Life series as it is set in the same universe but is a world all of its own. 10/10 a definite must buy. Still alive. The cake is a lie.

P.S. You can play coop with a buddy on PS3. This game just can't stop beeing cool.
Great game that gets the mind working.

Portal 2 was one of my most exciting buys for me EVER. I was seriously hyped up about it a while ago and it is a classic for me now. Despite this the game is still amazing, with a "hard" (Not tedious, but actually hard in a good way) and complete story. I recommend playing this game after Portal 1 to help you understand the story a bit.

I could play portal 1 over and over again... but portal 2... is different, the story is much longer, but yet supplies much more content e.g. Community levels and co-op, 8.5/10 wouldn't play again.

Yes this games story has almost no replayabilty... sorry Valve its a story you can only play once.
for me the controller only works in menus, I am not sure if this is a bug. Other than that great game!
